page.title: 17CUSTOMS(2)
page.content: Chipping Campden has a unique Morris Dancing team composed of six dancers, a fool, a hobby horse with the music played by a fiddler. They dance at important occasions like Scuttlebrook Wake and at fetes. The other great Campden tradition is the Campden Mummers. They have a play of great antiquity which tells the tale of King George and the Turkish Knight and how the former was slain and brought back to life by Dr Haro and his assistant Jack Vinney. The Mummers tour the pubs and big houses during the Christmas period and as the night goes on the play becomes less coherent. There is one curious custom on St Thomas's Day,December 21st of ringing the church bells at 6 a.m. then bread is distributed to the householders of Leysbourne.This was a charity bequest.
